title: Caral, The Oldest Civilization of America: Full-Day Tour from Lima
provider:

Andrew B
16 contributions

Excellent

Caral, the oldest known 'city' in the Americas, is well preserved and impressive. It's a long drive from Lima, so going on a tour takes a lot of the hard work out of organising a trip to the site. Our guide, Johanna, from peruna tours was knowledgeable, well organised, patient and considerate. Be prepared for a long day. Remember the sunscreen.
Written August 1, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Olivia
Dubai, United Arab Emirates71 contributions

do not recommend to book

I've booked the tour in advance, impatiently waiting for 2 Jan to visit the place Caral. I arrived in Peru from faraway Dubai, and I couldn't think that anyone from that agency had appeared on time or before and announced that there was any issue to re-plan my day. My day was ruined, I lost an opportunity to visit Caral thanks to that unprofessional agency.
Written January 2, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Pathfinder_0490
32 contributions

Secret City of Caral

Carlos was great. He picked us up on time and we made great time to Caral and back. The site is wonderful and there are constant excavations and exploring since it's a relatively new discovery (the site was discovered mid 1990s). The site was mostly free of tourists which makes it easier to appreciate. The one issue we had was this tour was supposed to go to Barranca but we ended up in Huacho instead for lunch.
Written November 7, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Alycristango T
52 contributions

Unmissable visit in Peru

The guided tour of Caral’s civilization with Lener was an exceptional experience. His deep knowledge and passion for the history of this ancient civilization made every moment fascinating. Lener not only took us through the impressive archaeological sites, but also offered us a unique perspective on the life and culture of the ancient inhabitants of Caral. His ability to answer our questions and share really enriched the visit. I recommend this experience to anyone interested in history and archaeology; it is truly unforgettable.
Automatically translated

Sarah Wagner
9 contributions

Better to travel by yourself if you want to go further north anyway

Jun 2024 • Solo
The team (guide and driver) were great. The excavations were interesting, but are a work in progress. Very long journey and high price for a 1.5 hour tour. We had to skip the Christo because of traffic. Snacks were not offered.
Written June 20, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
CBGB G
3 contributions

Authentic History

Visiting this recently uncovered archeological spot was a unique look into the oldest civilisation in the Americas. The site is still being explored, and the ruins had an authentic 'in progress ' feel. Don't expect finished structures; the site is simple, and few people have discovered this unique and mysterious ruin. Our guide Jose was excellent, providing lots of info on the site and many other insights into Peruvian culture.
Written June 10, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

A lot of history

Jan 2024 • Couples
My wife and I went to visit this archeological city, it is not very crowded so it is a good plan to escape for a day, the site was the home of an ancient culture in Peru, we learnned a lot about history. I would recommend to bring sunscreen.

Fascinating site with a deep history

Dec 2023 • Solo
This was a fascinating trip. Caral is a very large site, and Jaynor and Carlos treated us with professionalism and friendliness. I recommend this to anyone with an archaeological interest. Also, remember to bring sunscreen!
Written December 11, 2023

reviews.title: Excellent tour, excellent guide!
reviews.text: Alejandro was a wonderful guide & Carlos was a great driver. We were picked up on time. They took us to a very good local restaurant on the way there and back. Alejandro was extremely knowledgeable about the site of Caral and about Peru in general. The site was fantastic and it is still being developed! Alejandro was extremely personable. I highly recommend this tour!
